pkgmetadata.longdescription: Metrics for Assessing the Quality of Generated Text // Implementation of the BLEU-Score in 'C++' to evaluate the quality of generated text. The BLEU-Score, introduced by Papineni et al. (2002) doi:10.3115/1073083.1073135, is a metric for evaluating the quality of generated text. It is based on the n-gram overlap between the generated text and reference texts. Additionally, the package provides some smoothing methods as described in Chen and Cherry (2014) doi:10.3115/v1/W14-3346.
